cards.name: Abyssal Nightstalker
cards.originalText: If Abyssal Nightstalker attacks and isn't blocked, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.text: Whenever Abyssal Nightstalker attacks and isn't blocked, defending player discards a card.

cards.name: Angel of Fury
cards.originalText:
Flying
If Angel of Fury is put into your graveyard from play, you may choose to shuffle Angel of Fury into your library.

rulings.text: If Angel of Fury is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it will remain in its zone when its owner shuffles his or her library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has it move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

Angel of Fury's second ability is a leaves-the-battlefield ability. Because it works only from on the battlefield, it behaves differently than the _Lorwyn_ Incarnations. When Angel of Fury is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it will look back in time (to the point just before it left the battlefield) to see if its ability triggers. That means the following: -- If Angel of Fury lost its triggered ability while on the battlefield (due to Snakeform, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would not trigger. Angel of Fury would stay in its owner's graveyard. -- If Angel of Fury had its triggered ability when it left the battlefield, but lost it when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability would still trigger. Angel of Fury would be shuffled into its owner's library.

cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Fury dies, you may shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.name: Deathcoil Wurm
cards.originalText: If Deathcoil Wurm attacks and is blocked, you may choose to have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.text: You may have Deathcoil Wurm assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping creatures and lands.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play from your hand, search your library for a Goblin card and put that card into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor:
"Our steeds need food, water, stabling. Theirs just need prey."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal
cards.name: Raiding Nightstalker
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Raiding Nightstalker can't be blocked.)
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.
cards.name: Rain of Daggers
cards.originalText: Destroy all your opponent's creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, you lose 2 life.
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

cards.flavor:
"Life from death is part of the natural cycle. This is merely a shortcut."
—Tojira, swamp queen
cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.originalText: Return any one creature from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Rally the Troops
cards.originalText:
Play Rally the Troops only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Untap all your creatures.
cards.text:
Cast Rally the Troops only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Untap all creatures you control.

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats comes into play from your hand, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.flavor:
One razorclaw is three bears too many.
—Elvish saying
cards.name: Razorclaw Bear
cards.originalText: If Razorclaw Bear attacks and is blocked, it gets +2/+2 until the end of the turn.
cards.text: Whenever Razorclaw Bear becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.originalText: Untap all your creatures that attacked this turn. You may declare an additional attack this turn.

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.name: Remove
cards.originalText:
Play Remove only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Return any one attacking creature to its owner's hand.
cards.text:
Cast Remove only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Death just encourages life the more.
cards.name: Renewing Touch
cards.originalText: Choose any number of creature cards in your graveyard and shuffle them into your library.
cards.text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Return of the Nightstalkers
cards.originalText: Return all the Nightstalker cards from your graveyard to play. Then destroy all your swamps. (Treat these Nightstalkers as though they just came into play from your hand.)
cards.text: Return all Nightstalker permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. Then destroy all Swamps you control.

cards.flavor:
"Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal
cards.name: Righteous Charge
cards.originalText: All your creatures get +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Righteous Fury
cards.originalText: Destroy all tapped creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, you gain 2 life. (This includes your creatures.)
cards.text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

cards.flavor: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.
cards.name: River Bear
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player has any islands in play, River Bear can't be blocked.)
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavor:
"What was taken shall be restored."
—Arathel, elvish queen
cards.name: Salvage
cards.originalText: Take any one card from your graveyard and put that card on the top of your library.
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Screeching Drake
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Screeching Drake comes into play from your hand, draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.
cards.text:
Flying
When Screeching Drake enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Sea Drake
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sea Drake comes into play from your hand, return any two of your lands from play to your hand.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, if one of the lands has become an illegal target (because it's no longer on the battlefield, for example), you return the other one to your hand. If both of the lands have become illegal targets, the ability is countered. This has no effect on Sea Drake.

cards.text:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.originalText: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.originalText: Spitting Earth deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountains.)
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

cards.flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"
cards.name: Steam Catapult
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Steam Catapult to destroy any one tapped creature.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.flavor:
"Is it merchants or is it pirates?"
"It's Talas—there's no difference."
cards.name: Steam Frigate
cards.originalText: Steam Frigate can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.
cards.text: Steam Frigate can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.flavor: There goes the neighborhood!
cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.originalText: Destroy any one land.
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.originalText: B

cards.originalText: B

cards.name: Swarm of Rats
cards.originalText: Swarm of Rats has power equal to the number of Rat cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped Rat cards.)
cards.text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.

cards.name: Sylvan Basilisk
cards.originalText: If Sylvan Basilisk attacks and is blocked, destroy all creatures blocking it. (Destroy the creatures before they deal damage. The Basilisk doesn't damage your opponent.)
cards.text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.

cards.flavor: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.
cards.name: Sylvan Yeti
cards.originalText: Sylvan Yeti has power equal to the number of cards you have in your hand.
cards.text: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.flavor:
"Their ships pollute our air as they themselves pollute our forest."
—Arathel, elvish queen
cards.name: Talas Air Ship
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Talas Explorer
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Talas Explorer comes into play from your hand, look at your opponent's hand.
cards.text:
Flying
When Talas Explorer enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.

cards.flavor: The trader let loose a laugh that made all around him check their purses.
cards.name: Talas Merchant

cards.flavor:
From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.
cards.name: Talas Researcher
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Talas Researcher to draw a card.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.flavor:
"Scouting a battle before you fight it is just good business."
—Jefan, Talas ship captain
cards.name: Talas Scout
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: The sea is in their blood. Literally.
cards.name: Talas Warrior
cards.originalText: Talas Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.text: Talas Warrior can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.
cards.name: Temple Acolyte
cards.originalText: When Temple Acolyte comes into play from your hand, you gain 3 life.
cards.text: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"Give us breath. Give us life. Prepare us for the day we make."
—The Alaborn "Rite of Battle"
cards.name: Temple Elder
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Temple Elder to gain 1 life.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.flavor: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.
cards.name: Temporal Manipulation
cards.originalText: You take another turn after this one.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.flavor: "First they fight, then they sleep, then they dream. And finally I receive my reward."
cards.name: Theft of Dreams
cards.originalText: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.

cards.flavor: Four little goblins, trapped by the sea. One teased a serpent, and then there were three.
cards.name: Tidal Surge
cards.originalText: Tap any one, two, or three creatures without flying. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
cards.text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.

cards.flavor:
"The ogre had come from out of the blue, so that's where I sent it back."
—Talas wizard
cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.originalText: Return any one creature from play to the top of its owner's library.
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."
cards.name: Touch of Brilliance
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
"So he gots a sword. Big deal."
"Yeah, it's a big deal—it's a big sword!"
—Two goblins outside the gates of Trokin
cards.name: Town Sentry
cards.originalText: If Town Sentry blocks, it gets +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
cards.text: Whenever Town Sentry blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"They serve the world best on a platter with shallots and onions."
—Talas sailor
cards.name: Tree Monkey
cards.originalText: Tree Monkey can block creatures with flying.
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.
cards.name: Tremor
cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures without flying.)
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.flavor: Battle tempers soldiers as fire tempers steel.
cards.name: Trokin High Guard
Undo
cards.originalText: Return any two creatures from play to their owner's hand. (You can't play Undo unless you can choose two creatures to return.)

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

cards.text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.originalText: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit comes into play from your hand, you lose 4 life. (The person who plays Vampiric Spirit loses the life.)
cards.text:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit enters the battlefield, you lose 4 life.

cards.flavor: A bullet renders all sizes equal.
cards.name: Vengeance
cards.originalText: Destroy any one tapped creature.
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.
cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.originalText: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: People fight hardest on their own soil.

cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Wild Ox can't be blocked.)
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Wildfire
cards.originalText: You destroy four of your lands and your opponent destroys four of his or her lands. Then Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.flavor: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.
cards.name: Wind Sail
cards.originalText: Any one or two creatures gain flying until the end of the turn.
cards.text: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.
